result.execSummary:
The defendant Marc V Olsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $800.00 forfeiture to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
Must provide DNA sample & pay a $200.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
